document.docAuthor: Li, Weichun, Li, Houhun & Nuss, Matthias
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Scoparia Haworth, 1811 (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of Scoparia Haworth, 1811 (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae) from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

Walker, 1859
: 826
;
Caradja & Meyrick, 1935

. Type locality: Sri Lanka .

: 22

Inoue, 1982
: 312
, pl. 36 fig. 39 , pl. 300 fig. 5 , pl. 301 fig. 4 ;
Song, 2003
, in Wang et al. (eds.): 192 , fig. 239 . Type locality: Mt. Tateyama, Japan .

:
2 33, 2
Ƥ, NW-Frontier Nurreo, 1700 m ,
29 .vii. 1979
, leg. W. Thomas, MTD .

Diagnosis.
Scoparia congestalis
is similar to
S. afghanorum
in the wing pattern and male genitalia. It can be distinguished by the phallus with a scobinate ovate plate and many tiny spinelike cornuti attached to the plate, whereas the phallus of
S. afghanorum
lacks ovate plate and cornutus.

Distribution. China (Anhui, Fujian, Gansu, Guangxi, Guizhou, Henan, Hong Kong , Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Shaanxi, Shanghai, Sichuan, Taiwan , Tianjin , Xizang (Tibet), Yunnan, Zhejiang); Korea , Japan , Sri Lanka , Pakistan , Russia .

Remarks.
Scoparia isochroalis
Hampson, 1907
is identical to
S. congestalis
Walker, 1859
in the wing pattern and genitalia. It is synonymized with
S. congestalis
herein.
Scoparia congestalis
is recorded for the first time in Pakistan .
